value.name: Columbus approves $10M settlement with family of man fatally shot by officer
value.description: The size of the Hill settlement dwarfs another Columbus police settlement made just in February, $1,025,000 to the family of Donna Castleberry, a woman killed by an undercover Columbus police ...

value.name: One year after George Floyd: How far has Columbus come and how far is there still to go?
value.description: One year after the murder of George Floyd, there have been some changes in Columbus — such as the establishment of a civilian police review board — but not nearly as many as some activists would like.

video.name: George Floyd's family marks 1 year since his death

value.name: City settles Andre Hill shooting that resulted in an officer being fired
value.description: The city of Columbus has agreed to pay $10 million to the family of André Hill, an unarmed Black man fatally shot by former Columbus police officer Adam Coy in December, City Attorney Zach Klein announced Friday.
